DOC.brief_summary: In patients with sepsis and AKI, increasing the intensity of renal replacement therapy from 50 mL/kg/h (HVHF) to 85 mL/kg/h (EHVHF)will increase the survival at 28 days and 90 days.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of the Intensity of Continuous Renal Replacement Therapy
DOC.criteria: met at least one of the following criteria: oliguria (urine output less than 100 mL in a 6 h period and unresponsive to fluid resuscitation), serum potassium concentration more than 6.5 mmol/L, severe acidemia (pH < 7.2), serum creatinine more than 250 µmol/L, or presence of severe organ edema (e.g. pulmonary edema). were presence of a malignant tumor, chronic renal insufficiency (serum creatinine >133 µmol/L), or receiving any kind of renal replacement therapy before randomization.
